rComments: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!! hard to follow, doesn't provide clear guidelines for assignments either on brightspace or in class, NEVER answers emails if you have questions and don't bother asking them in class either he doesn't care. Provides little to no feedback on assignments, syllabus is extremely unclear.

I usually am okay with subpar professors but drop this class. He's often late, doesn't know when class ends, forgets about assignments, teaches stuff unrelated to the course material, and requires the listening of audio files that simply dont work if you do not have a windows PC. It's easier to do the base french course without this class.

DROP HIS CLASS. I took this accompanying class to fulfill my french immersion requirements, and I wish I had taken anything else!!! He is so boring and dull and makes no sense. He forces participation. I sent many emails throughout the semester, and not one has been answered. Announced our midterm the day before. Nice guy but an AWFUL TEACHER

He's nice, a good person. But sometimes people can be good people but absolute garbage at their job. I think this is one of those cases. He'll help you outside of class hours, but I never knew what was going on, the syllabus was unclear, and he was difficult to understand in the way that he didn't ever explain anything well.

I learned absolutely nothing from this course. The prof was often late or confused about what class he was in. This was supposed to be a class to improve comprehension of POL1502, but POL1502 ended up being way easier to follow. His voice is hard to understand and monotonous, nobody was ever listening during class. Very little work in this class.
He's a very sweet person where you feel comfortable in his lectures. Material wasn't too difficult.
Did not respond to a single email I sent all semester.... Since it was on an online class and there was no TA this was very unreasonable.

Prof. Kapenda is the sweetest professor Ive ever had. He is so caring and the nicest man ever. I loved every single one of his classes, I wish I could take it again. The workload is not much, and he marks fairly. 100% recommend. Amazing guy.

I enjoyed having prof Kapenda as a prof. He is kind and is dedicated in helping his students succeed. Its a fairly easy course as long as you hand in your assignments. He may be a dry professor but I was not looking for an entertainer.

Absolute waste of a prof. Came to class 20 minutes late. Would leave in the middle of evaluations. He never had office hours and did not answer emails. He graded arbitrarily and had no reason for giving one student an A+ and another an A. Little direction in class and was a waste of time. Do not take ANY of his classes.

While the class content was very easy, Prof. Kapenda somehow managed to make it both extremely boring and extremely confusing at the same time. He was late to every class, and generally seemed unorganized. Most of his class exercises involved the entire class reading passages from the textbook out loud in unison.

His teaching abilities are lacking, he teaches as though he is giving an oral presentation and thus his lessons are often dull and not well articulated. He has no real marking scheme: my class compared results on work handed back and his corrections were inconsistent each time. Midterm structure was nothing like what we were taught & class avg sank

One of the worst profs I've come across. I'm in my fourth year biochem taking an FLS class to get my french immersion certificate. He barely has a grasp on the grammar concepts he teaches. He is terrible and answering questions. His accent is sometimes hard to understand. He wastes SO much time in class pulling up his slides.

I had him for the companion course to POL1501 and I honestly found POL easier to follow than his lectures. It's an easy A but not really worth being bored out of your mind for an hour and a half every week. His grading criteria seems random and all over the place, plus he tried to change the midterm to a week earlier with no notice.

I took Prof Kapenda's accompaniment class for POL 1501. I'm a raging anglophone, so his lessons definitely helped me with the course content. That being said, his lectures can be dry and there isn't too much substance to the FLS 2581 courses in general. If you aren't struggling with your comprehension, this class will likely bore you too much.
Prof was beyond unorganized, expectations were always unclear. The class is an easy A, but he beyond boring and made the class frustrated with his teaching methods various times.
He is such a sweet prof who just wants to give his students the best

It was very easy to do well in this class, but Kapenda is a very boring prof. If you want an easy A this is a good class, but just be ready to be bored. There were only 15 students in the class and he could not remember a single persons name which i thought was a bit ridiculous. He also doesn't reply to emails and is very difficult to contact.
Prof Kapenda is seriously the best prof you'll ever have!! Most caring and understanding professor on campus. Very clear grading criteria and a light workload. Easy A+.

Monsieur Kapenda est un très bon prof! Il donne le temps précis pour aider à tous et en fait sa classe est parfaite si quelque chose n'a pas été claire dans le cours principal (j'ai pris FLS pour ECO1502). Il faut le dire aussi, monsieur Kapenda est une personne très agréable! Faîtes vos devoirs et lisez le livre.

Although Kapenda was a sweet man, this course will not improve your French language skills, nor help you in the subject you are studying. Sure his class is an easy A, but he gives no feedback or explanation on any of the assignments or midterms.

A really amazing professor who thoroughly explains new concepts and wants his students to do well. His lectures could be a little dry and if the class wasn't 7-10 I probably would have like it better, but he's overall very good for French as a second language.

Such a sweetheart. So patient and caring. His explanations are super thorough and he's  just an overall amazing prof. His dictees are really easy as long as you do your homework (which isn't much) Definitely choose him to be your prof!

He is extremely kind and helpful. If you go to him, he will explain very clearly what was missed in class. Class might be slow, but it's easy to understand. Even though his handwriting on the board is really bad, he writes straight from the textbook, which is blessed. Just do your homework, ask questions, smile and you'll get an easy A. :)

Really boring class. I feel like if I had him for a different class I might like him better, but I can't pay attention at all in his class. He isn't very clear with what he expects from his students, but as long as you get the assignments in on time, you will do well in the course.

I had the opportunity to work with prof Kapend and must say that I learned a lot. I have a clearer understanding of the nuances in French grammar.  As a prof, he's nice, understanding and a fir marker. Thank you
Excellent professor in all the ways.
I have just completed a great French Political sc. course with this professor. He's one of my best professors; nice, competent and understanding. It was an excellent course altogether.
Good professor with an excellent personality. Patient, understanding and dynamic.
The part of the course I enjoyed the most was finally understanding the many exceptions and rules in French grammar. Previous teachers have not succeeded in teaching as well as this professor.

Interesting. Not only he helped me understand my course of International relations through discussions, he initiated us to critical thinking. For the very first time, I learned how to write a synthesis from a variety of documents. Besides, the prof. is fair and a fair marker.
I was very happy with this course in that I learned what I was hoping to learn in advanced writing. The professor showed a great deal of competence both in the French language and writing skills.
Great professor. Very knowledgeabe in French, his explanation on details was clear. I learned a lot in this basic class.

Pretty nice guy, and interesting if you actually get the chance to have a conversation with him. The class I had was pretty boring, but the content wasn't really his fault. Pretty easy going, and a fair marker, but if you don't have to take FLS, I wouldn't bother. (On the other hand, if you are looking for a good grade, it's not hard to get)

Completely unclear prof, doesn't explain what he wants from assignments. I saw comments before taking his class about dropping it and decided not to...I wish I had. His course material isn't relevant to the French course, forces students to do assignments on sections that have already been marked by the midterm. Drop his course

This prof is a nice man, but the worst prof I've ever had in University (I'm going into 5th year).  My class actually got together to try and organize a meeting with the head of the FLS department to do something about his way of teaching. Unless you can't wait another year, drop this class.

I have no idea what the previous comments are talking about! This was absolutely the worst prof I have had at this uni (& I'm in 3rd year). Do not take this class if you actually want to learn something. The fact that he's still teaching made me realize how little the FLS dept. cares about the quality of its profs. & I switched programs b/c of this
Clear teaching style, with clear assignments. He wasn't very jazzed about the subject matter. Not bad over all. Easy to understand.

Great prof. Really enjoyed his class. Seems interested in the material and if there is anything that you do not understand he is quite helpful. Slightly disorganized and forgetful but gracious for the reminders.

Worst prof at uOttawa! Forgetful, disorganised, and spoke to us in English - funny, considering we are an advanced french immersion class. Will not admit he's wrong - he made tons of mistakes correcting, I had it checked by other profs. GET OUT OF HIS CLASS IF YOU HAVE HIM!

M. Kapenda is a really good professor. He's knowledgeable and knows very well how to convey the material. It also helps that he's so well versed in french!  He's one of the best professors that i have ever had the privileged to be taught by!
A really good prof with a skilled knowledge in french.  He challenges the class and I like that.

I have mixed feelings about this prof. On one hand, I felt that I was learning in his class. Each class explored a different, useful topic. He's also a very forgiving marker. However, I never felt comfortable asking questions or speaking in French.
The worst prof at u Ottawa! If you get him get out of the class now!

Awful, awful, afwul. One of the worst teachers I ever had. No organization, no challenge, no good explanations (waste of time on basic stuff and no explanations of the real important/difficult/new stuff), no coherence whatsoever in the course and its materials... do I need to continue?
No Comments
